intro: Elatostema madagascariense var. marojejyense, commonly known as the Marojejy elatostema, is a rare plant native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle-like plants, and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a low shrub or herb, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, and it produces small greenish-white flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
